intro: Calceolaria costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Costa Rica. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, slipper-shaped flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant has elongated, hairy leaves and thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. It is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes. Due to habitat loss, it is also considered a species of conservation concern.
